sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 10 cm and bases of 8 cm and 12 cm. What is the area of the trapezoid?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, we use the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (sum of the bases) × height

In this case, the height is 10 cm, and the bases are 8 cm and 12 cm. So, we plug these values into the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (8 + 12) × 10

Area = (1/2) × 20 × 10

Area = 10 × 10

Area = 100 square centimeters

The area of the trapezoid is 100 square centimeters.
